justification: The article notes that “Feeding-induced dopamine release in dorsal striatum correlates with meal pleasantness ratings in healthy human volunteers (Small et al., 2003),” indicating that the construct ‘meal pleasantness’ was assessed with participants’ pleasantness rating scales.

Referring to Brunstrom et al. (2011), the text states that “expectations about future satiety prior to consumption significantly impact subjective reports of fullness even hours later,” showing that the construct ‘subjective fullness’ was captured through self-report fullness measures.
